alert.note: Alert for Yell (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 24 at 7:26PM CST until January 26 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Arkansas... Petit Jean River At Danville affecting Yell County. For the Petit Jean River...including Danville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Petit Jean River at Danville. * WHEN...Until Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Agricultural lands along the river are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 20.2 feet. - Forecast...The river cresting at near a stage of 20.2 feet this evening. The river is expected to fall below flood stage tonight. Additional rises could be possible later in the week. Continue to monitor latest forecasts for updates. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Petit Jean River Danville 20.0 20.2 Wed 6 pm CST 14.6 12.5 15.0 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS. The next statement will be issued Thursday evening at 730 PM CST.
